str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Apparently a primary word; an 'hour'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
